page.title: 11The Wat Tyler Public House
page.content: When Mr Simpson started work as a publican at the Wat Tyler the place was derelict. There were mice and dust all over the place. He cleaned, redecorated and was ready for business in December 1984. The trade was very slow due to the Miner's Strike and a general lack of money in the community. Mr Simpson introduced pool and darts to attract the customers. Towards the end of the strike business began to pick up and he added discos and quizzes to his entertainment. The pub now has a lot of regulars. Their favourite drink is beer and they drink 4-5 barrels a week (each holding 18 gallons). Mr Simpson has no problems with drunks and enjoys running his pub very much although,being a seven day working week,he gets very tired at times.
